Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Currencies (2025-09-16)

Currencies

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data reveals a nuanced sentiment across major currency markets this week. While the Brazilian Real demonstrates extreme speculative bullishness, several G10 currencies are experiencing either a notable unwinding of long positions or significant short-covering, suggesting a potential shift in underlying momentum.

Key Opportunities

  • Brazilian Real (BRL) - Bullish Momentum: Speculative net-longs are at extreme levels (COT Index 85.33, Z-score 2.79) and continue to rise, indicating strong conviction and potential for further upside.
  • British Pound (GBP) - Short Covering: A substantial reduction of 27,025 contracts in speculative net-short positions points to potential for continued short-covering and a price rebound.
  • Swiss Franc (CHF) - Squeeze Setup: Heavily net-short positioning with initial short-covering and falling open interest creates conditions ripe for a sharp short squeeze.

Key Risks

  • Brazilian Real (BRL) - Overextension: Extreme net-long positioning presents significant exhaustion risk; aggressive profit-taking could trigger a sharp correction.
  • Japanese Yen (JPY) - Fading Conviction: A massive reduction in speculative net-longs (-30,232 contracts) signals eroding bullish support and increased downside vulnerability.
  • EURO FX (EUR) - Softening Momentum: A notable decrease in speculative net-longs and open interest suggests a potential pause or reversal in its upward trend.

Asset Class Summaries

Brazilian Real (BRL)

  • Speculators: Dominantly bullish with an extreme net-long position (62,222 contracts), increasing significantly by 6,135 WoW. Positioning is highly stretched (COT Index: 85.33, Z-score: 2.79).
  • Commercial (Hedger): Heavily net-short, consistent with their role of hedging against prevailing market sentiment.
  • Implication: Strong momentum persists, but extreme positioning warns of significant exhaustion risk.

Japanese Yen (JPY)

  • Speculators: Remain net-long (61,411 contracts) but unwound a massive -30,232 contracts WoW. Open interest plunged significantly.
  • Commercial (Hedger): Net-short, absorbing the rapid unwinding of speculative long positions.
  • Implication: Bullish conviction is rapidly eroding, implying potential for continued downside pressure.

EURO FX (EUR)

  • Speculators: Bullish with a substantial net-long position (117,759 contracts), though reduced by 7,918 WoW. Open interest also declined.
  • Commercial (Hedger): Net-short, reflecting hedging against softening speculative long exposure.
  • Implication: Bullish momentum is clearly softening; watch for further unwinding if sentiment shifts negatively.

British Pound (GBP)

  • Speculators: Net-short (-6,580 contracts), but significantly covered -27,025 shorts WoW. Open interest dropped sharply.
  • Commercial (Hedger): Net-long, aligning with their hedging activity against reduced speculative shorts.
  • Implication: Strong short-covering suggests a potential bottom or reversal, but sustained buying is required for a lasting uptrend.

Mexican Peso (MXN)

  • Speculators: Dominantly bullish with a significant net-long position (77,993 contracts), increasing by 4,261 WoW. Positioning is robust (COT Index: 79.19, Z-score: 1.86).
  • Commercial (Hedger): Net-short, acting as counterparties to the strong speculative buying.
  • Implication: Sustained bullish conviction points to continued upside, but is approaching crowded levels.

Swiss Franc (CHF)

  • Speculators: Heavily net-short (-26,040 contracts), but reduced exposure by 2,799 WoW amidst falling open interest. The 'squeeze setup' flag is active.
  • Commercial (Hedger): Net-long, indicating a counter-position to persistent speculative shorts.
  • Implication: Signs of short-covering amid extreme bearish positioning; a short squeeze scenario is plausible.
